metric.name: Total Agent Invocations
metric.description: Shows the total number of invocations since the last restart.

metric.name: Average Agent Processing Time (sec)
metric.description: Shows the average agent processing time in seconds per event.

metric.name: Dumpster Size
metric.description: Shows the total size (in bytes) of mail items that are currently in the transport dumpster on this server.

metric.name: Dumpster Item Count
metric.description: Shows the total number of mail items that are currently in the transport dumpster on this server.

metric.name: Dumpster Inserts/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate at which items are inserted into the transport dumpster on this server.

metric.name: Dumpster Deletes/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate at which items are deleted from the transport dumpster on this server.

metric.name: Unreachable Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the Unreachable queue.

metric.name: Largest Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the largest delivery queues.

metric.name: Poison Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the poison message queue.

metric.name: Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues)
metric.description: Shows the number of messages queued for delivery in all queues.

metric.name: Active Remote Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the active remote delivery queues.

metric.name: Active Mailbox Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the active mailbox queues.

metric.name: Submission Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the submission queue.

metric.name: Active Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in the Drop directory that is used by a Foreign connector.

metric.name: Retry Mailbox Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in a retry state attempting to deliver a message to a remote mailbox.

metric.name: Retry Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in a retry state in the non-Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) gateway delivery queues.

metric.name: Retry Remote Delivery Queue Length
metric.description: Shows the number of messages in a retry state in the remote delivery queues.

metric.name: Messages Submitted Per Second
metric.description: Shows the number of messages that have been queued in the Submission queue per second.

metric.name: Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second
metric.description: Shows the number of messages that have been queued for delivery per second.

property.value: Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second

metric.name: Messages Completed Delivery Per Second
metric.description: Shows the number of messages that are delivered per second.

metric.name: Inbound: LocalDeliveryCallsPerSecond
metric.description: Shows the number of local delivery attempts per second.

metric.name: Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
metric.description: Shows the number of mail items per second being submitted.

property.value: Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

metric.name: Inbound: MessageDeliveryAttemptsPerSecond
metric.description: Shows the number of attempts for delivering transport mail items per second.

metric.name: Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
metric.description: Shows the number of inbound recipients delivered per second.

metric.name: Average bytes/message
metric.description: Shows the average number of message bytes per inbound message received.

metric.name: Messages Received/sec
metric.description: Shows the number of messages received by the SMTP server each second.

metric.name: Messages Sent/sec
metric.description: Shows the number of messages sent by the SMTP send connector each second.

metric.name: I/O Database Reads (Attached) Average Latency
metric.description: Shows the average length of time, in milliseconds, per database read operation. It indicates the average time, in milliseconds (ms), to read from the database file. The average returned value should be below 20ms. Spikes (maximum values) shouldn't be higher than 100ms.

metric.name: I/O Database Writes (Attached) Average Latency
metric.description: Indicates the average time, in ms, to write to the database file. This counter is not a good indicator for client latency because database writes are asynchronous. In general, this latency should be less than the MSExchange Database\I/O Database Reads (Attached) Average Latency when battery-backed write caching is utilized.

metric.name: I/O Log Writes Average Latency
metric.description: Indicates the average time, in ms, to write a log buffer to the active log file. The returned values should be 10 on production servers. If this counter is greater than 10, it is an indication that the MSExchange Database\I/O Database Writes (Attached) Average Latency is too high.

metric.name: I/O Database Reads (Recovery) Average Latency
metric.description: Indicates the average time, in ms, to read from the database file. The average returned values should be below 200ms. Spikes (maximum values) should not be higher than 1,000ms.

metric.name: I/O Database Writes (Recovery) Average Latency
metric.description: Indicates the average time, in ms, to write to the database file. In general, this latency should be less than the MSExchange Database\I/O Database Reads (Recovery) Average Latency when battery-backed write caching is utilized.

metric.name: I/O Log Reads Average Latency
metric.description: Indicates the average time, in ms, to read data from a log file. This is specific to log replay and database recovery operations. The average returned value should be below 200ms. Spikes (maximum values) should not be higher than 1,000ms.

metric.name: Version buckets allocated
metric.description: Shows the total number of version buckets allocated. The returned values should be less than 12,000 at all times. The maximum default version is 16,384. If version buckets reach 70% of maximum, the server is at risk of running out of the version store.

metric.name: Database Cache Size (MB)
metric.description: Shows the amount of system memory, in megabytes (MB), used by the database cache manager to hold commonly used information from the database files to prevent file operations. The maximum value is 2GB of RAM (3GB for servers with sync replication enabled). This and Database Cache Hit % are useful counters for gauging whether a server's performance problems might be resolved by adding more physical memory. Use this counter along with Store Private Bytes to determine if there are store memory leaks. If the database cache size seems too small for optimal performance and there is little available memory on the system (check the value of Memory/Available Bytes), adding more memory to the system may increase performance. If there is ample memory on the system and the database cache size is not growing beyond a certain point, the database cache size may be capped at an artificially low limit. Increasing this limit may increase performance.

metric.name: Log Bytes Write/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate of bytes written to the log. The returned values should be less than 10,000,000 at all times. With each log file being 1,000,000 bytes in size, 10,000,000 bytes/sec would yield 10 logs per second. This may indicate a large message being sent or a looping message.

metric.name: I/O Log Writes/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate of log file write operations completed.

metric.name: I/O Log Reads/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate of log file read operations completed.

metric.name: Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
metric.description: Represents the amount of work, in count of log files, that need to be redone or undone to the database files if the process fails.

metric.name: Version buckets allocated
metric.description: Total number of version buckets allocated.

metric.name: I/O Database Reads/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate of database read operations completed.

metric.name: I/O Database Writes/sec
metric.description: Shows the rate of database write operations completed.

metric.name: Log Record Stalls/sec
metric.description: Shows the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

metric.name: Log Threads Waiting
metric.description: Shows the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

description.value: When monitoring servers running Microsoft Exchange Server with the Hub Transport server role installed
